title: Why do people even AD Thresh...it's so stupid...
body:
Benefits from AD:

None other than better AAs

Benefits from not AD:

Everything but AAs

Why do people even AD Thresh? It's so bad...AD Thresh is so squishy, low ranged, inefficient, low effort-to-benefit ratio...why do tryhards still do this?

Isn't Tank+CDR Thresh so much more rewarding, easier-to-play, useful-to-team, play-making, respected, to play?
Out of all the AD Threshs I've seen in my whole life, only two AD Threshes became useful to the team...

What's wrong with AD thresh? He has ridiculous burst in his first auto, then can stall time via cc until his next burst auto comes up. He is also incredibly easy to kite as. Just because he only has one way to hurt enemies doesn't mean he sucks. I play ad mordekaiser and ad taric, who do no damage outside AA, yet I still crush people 1v3 as ad taric while I 2 shot people as ad morde.
Also according to ur logic vayne also sucks since she only does damage via autos and that very occasional e.

AD Thresh is done because his auto-attacks get stronger throughout the game due to the collection of souls mainly, and the idea of the build is to hit hard with autos like with any ADC build. The addition of attack speed is useful of Thresh because it means his passive is proceed more too. To be honest though, it is a high-risk, low reward build. Like tank Thresh, he still gains AP to improve his abilities too.

However...
"His basic attack wind up is only reduced by 0.25% per 1% attack speed, rather than the standard 1%." - The LoL wiki.
They implemented this change sometimes after his release. Thresh used to be better as AD Thresh, and the idea still exists although it is not as good as it used to.

My view: AD Thresh can be done but why bother? You can do AD Bruiser Thresh, I think, but an ADC build for him is just %%%%.

TL;DR - if you want to do this, there are better champions. If you want to trade AD scales for utility as an ADC, I believe there are better champs for this. To be honest, I am surprised that I don't see more ADC Lulus since I see ADC Threshs. Her autos change normally, and she still gets magic damage from her passive while having utility. However, I still wouldn't really use her as an ADC.
